Seabad Lewat, Kapal Nyangkut di Air Terjun Niagara Akhirnya Geser
06 Nov 2019, 08:38 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Foto: (aisa.marisa.tjhong/d'Traveler)

Ontario - Sebuah kapal besi kuno berukuran raksasa menyangkut di bebatuan Air Terjun Niagara sejak lewat dari seabad lalu. Baru-baru ini, kapal itu akhirnya bergeser!Kapal yang sering disebut Iron Scow atau Niagara Scow ini telah nyangkut di bebatuan Air Terjun Niagara sejak kecelakaan pada tahun 1918 -- 101 tahun silam. Kapal ini terjebak dan tidak kunjung berpindah tempat dari lokasinya sekitar 600 meter jelang tepi air terjun.Sampai pada Kamis lalu, angin dan hujan badai membuat kapal ini bergeser dari lokasinya yang sudah ditempati selama seabad lewat. Manajer Senior Taman Niagara Jim Hill menyebut, kapal itu bergeser sekitar 50 meter dari lokasi semula. Dia juga menambahkan bahwa kapal tersebut ditemukan dalam posisi terbalik."Kami kira kapal bergeser sekitar 50 meter di sungai dari lokasi semula," kata Jim Hill.

[Gambas:Twitter]

Untuk saat ini, CEO Taman Niagara David Adames meyakini bahwa posisi kapal yang juga menjadi ikon air terjun Niagara itu masih akan tetap aman di posisinya sekarang. Tapi bisa saja bergeser lagi jika ada cuaca buruk."Tampaknya aman untuk saat ini. Namun, cuaca buruk mungkin akan menggesernya lagi," kata David.Kisah tentang bagaimana kapal ini bisa tersangkut di bebatuan air terjun Niagara ini sendiri belum diketahui banyak orang. Kapal ini mengalami kecelakaan dan melibatkan dua orang pria yang bernama James Harris dan Gustav Loffberg. Kedua pria ini diselamatkan oleh Pengawas Pantai Amerika Serikat dan otoritas Kanada. Pihak berwajib memutuskan bahwa penyelamatan kapal terlalu beresiko, sehingga sejak saat itu, kapal tetap berada di bebatuan Niagara, antara perbatasan Ontario di Kanada dan negara bagian New York. Setelah lewat seabad berada di posisinya dengan menghadapi terjangan badai dan ribuan ton air di Air Terjun Niagara, kapal ini akhirnya bergeser 50 meter dari tempatnya mengalami kecelakaan di tahun 1918.Simak Video "Kebocoran Gas di Hotel Kanada, 15 Orang Kritis"[Gambas:Video 20detik](elk/krs)

A century passed, the ship caught in Niagara Falls finally sliding
Nov 6, 2019, 08:38 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Photo: (aisa.marisa.tjhong / d'Traveler)

Ontario - A giant iron-sized ancient ship has clung to the rocks of Niagara Falls since passing a century ago. Recently, the ship finally shifted! The ship which is often called the Iron Scow or Niagara Scow has been stuck on the rocks of Niagara Falls since the accident in 1918 - 101 years ago. This ship is trapped and does not move from its location about 600 meters ahead of the edge of the waterfall. Until last Thursday, wind and rainstorms made this ship shift from its location that has been occupied for a century past. Niagara Park Senior Manager Jim Hill said the ship had shifted about 50 meters from its original location. He also added that the ship was found in an upside down position. "We think the ship shifted about 50 meters in the river from its original location," said Jim Hill.

[Gambas: Twitter]

For now, CEO of Niagara Park David Adames believes that the position of the ship which is also an icon of Niagara Falls will still be safe in its current position. But it could have shifted again if there was bad weather. "It seems safe for now. However, bad weather might shift it again," said David. The story of how this ship can get stuck on the rocks of Niagara Falls itself is not yet known to many people. This ship had an accident and involved two men named James Harris and Gustav Loffberg. The two men were rescued by the United States Coast Guard and Canadian authorities. The authorities decided that the rescue of the ship was too risky, so that since then, the ship has remained on the Niagara rocks, between the Ontario border in Canada and the state of New York. After passing through a century in its position by facing the storm and thousands of tons of water in Niagara Falls, this ship finally shifted 50 meters from where it crashed in 1918.
